page.title: 12FLOWER CARE:SHELLEY NURSERY
page.content: The only flowers at Shelley Nursery, Wigley are chrysanthemums.They need only 11 hours daylight otherwise they will produce greenery but no flowers. The cuttings are kept in a special area where there is a black screen,a white screen and electric light,so that the amount of daylight can be controlled. There are 3 diseases to guard against The chrysanthemums get a fungal disease,Potrytis,if the atmosphere is wrong.To cure it the atmosphere must be corrected,or chemicals used.The plants can also get Red Spider Mite, which is treated with larger spiders called Phytosieulus.These eat the mites and then eat each other.Aphids also attack the plants,so they are covered with a fungus which also covers the aphids and kills them.
